message: I look at the curtains covering my window.
Maybe I should get some fresh air...
I get out of bed and head over to the window.
Just as I'm about to open the curtains, I pause.
I hear something.
...Singing?
I peer through the curtains out onto the balcony.
But there's no one there. Did I imagine it?

name: クリア
message: "Master."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Woah!"
I hear a voice from above, and then something jumps down onto the balcony.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Clear?!"

name: クリア
message: "Yes. It's me."

name: 蒼葉
message: "You scared me... You were up on the roof?"

name: クリア
message: "Yes. I went up on the roof to sing."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Wait, so that was you singing?"

name: クリア
message: "Yes. I was singing the Jellyfish Song."

name: 蒼葉
message: "The Jellyfish Song?"

name: クリア
message: "Yes. The old man I used to live with talked about jellyfish a lot, so I made a song about them."

name: クリア
message: "Jellyfish are amazing, you know. Their bodies are almost entirely water, but they're alive, just like us."

name: クリア
message: "I wonder if jellyfish sleep and dream..."
I'm getting more and more confused.
It doesn't feel like he's screwing with me, though...
Clear steps next to me and takes something out of his pocket.
...That umbrella again.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What are you doing with that?"

name: クリア
message: "Is there something wrong with it?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "No... but why?"

name: クリア
message: "I thought the stars looked like they were about to fall."
I look up. As expected, there isn't a star in the sky, just the outlines of illegal construction sites obscuring the view.
Well, maybe it was my fault for expecting a coherent answer...

name: クリア
message: "By the way, Master."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hold up. You need to stop calling me that."

name: クリア
message: "But why?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "It's kind of creepy... Just call me Aoba."

name: クリア
message: "No, you're my master, Master. So I think I will call you Master."

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Okay."

name: クリア
message: "Master is Master, but Clear is the name the nice old man gave to me."

name: 蒼葉
message: "The nice old man? The one you wrote the Jellyfish Song for?"

name: クリア
message: "Yes. He passed away, though."

name: クリア
message: "We used to live near that area full of junk in the north quarter."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Junk... Oh, the waste treatment facility? So that's why you knew the area so well."

name: クリア
message: "Yes. By the way, Master, I was trying to tell you this earlier."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hm?"

name: クリア
message: "The other day, when we went to the north quarter to save Mr. Mizuki..."

name: クリア
message: "You turned into the cool version of Master. I was like, 'ding-ding-ding!'"

name: 蒼葉
message: "The... cool version?"

name: クリア
message: "Like the time I carried you back to the shop. Cool Master. But now, you're..."
Clear looks me over.

name: クリア
message: "You're still cool, Master!"
That was such an obvious cover...
Confused as I am, one of the things Clear said stands out.
The "cool version" of me... What does he mean by that?

name: クリア
message: "I'll be with you from now on, Master. I'll protect you."

name: クリア
message: "I hope you don't mind."
Clear closes his umbrella and sketches a perfect bow, his body bent to almost a right angle.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...So you're gonna keep calling me Master?"
I find myself smiling awkwardly.
What a strange guy. I still don't know what he's after... but he doesn't seem bad.

name: クリア
message: "Master, you should go to bed. It'll be tomorrow before you know it."

name: 蒼葉
message: "You're right. What about you?"

name: クリア
message: "I would like to sing on the roof a little longer, if you'll let me."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Just don't put any holes in the roof."

name: クリア
message: "Thank you, Master."
Clear bows to me again.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Later, then. Don't fall off."

name: クリア
message: "I won't."
I go back inside and close the curtains.
A minute later, I hear faint singing from outside the window.
It's tender and soft, almost like a lullaby.
It's... strangely relaxing...
As my anxiety melts away, I slowly close my eyes.
